lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Main.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Main.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents the entry point of the program.

* Consists of the logic to interact with the disk storage.
* Creates a storage object linked to a file specified by path.
* A new storage file is created if the file doesn't exist.
* @param path The path for the storage file
file.createNewFile(); // Creates a new file if the file doesn't exist, does nothing otherwise
assert Files.exists(Paths.get(this.fileName)) : "The file " + this.fileName + " doesn't exist.";

* Represents the command for adding a task with a start and end date.

Task task = new TaskEvent(this.name, this.done, this.start, this.end);

* @return The display message for the execution
* Represents the command to exit the application.
* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs
* @return The program will exit before returning anything
return ""; // Will never be run anyway
* Represents the command for finding all the tasks whose names contain a given string.

* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs

* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs

+ "Type 'deadline <name> <done (true/false)> <deadline (YYYY-MM-DD)>' to create a task with deadline.\n"
+ "to create an event with a start and end time.\n"
+ "Type 'list' to list out all your tasks.\n"

* @return The display message for the execution
// Converts the task list to a multiline string for display

* Represents the command for marking a task as done.
* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs
* @return The display message for the execution
return "Your task " + task.getName() + " has been completed.";
* Represents the command for removing a task.
* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs
* @return The display message for the execution
String rtn = "Your task " + task.getName() + " has been removed.";
* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs
* @return The display message for the execution
return "Unknown command. You can click 'Help' to see the commands.";
* Represents the command for unmarking a task as not done.
* @param taskManager The overall-in-charge for all task related affairs
* @return The display message for the execution
return "Your task " + task.getName() + " has been un-completed.";
